headline.main: PRESIDENT ORDERS SHIPS TAKEN OVER; CONVOY FOES LOSE; 2,000,000 Tons of Our Own and Foreign Vessels to Go at Once Into Bridge Overseas MARITIME BOARD TO ACT Senate Committee Hears From Hull and Smothers Two Anti-Convoy Resolutions PRESIDENT ORDERS SHIPS TAKEN OVER

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 30 -- While his leaders in Congress were beating down all efforts to restrict by law the use of American naval vessels for convoy purposes, President Roosevelt ordered the acquisition by the Maritime Commission of 2,000,000 tons of existing merchant shipping, domestic and foreign, for operation "in such a manner as will make their cargo space immediately effective in accomplishing our objective of all-out aid to the democracies."
abstract: Gets Roosevelt order for ship pool; outlines sources, s to U S Chamber of Commerce; appts H H Robson to amass fleet
snippet: WASHINGTON, April 30 -- While his leaders in Congress were beating down all efforts to restrict by law the use of American naval vessels for convoy purposes, President Roosevelt ordered the acquisition by the Maritime Commission of 2,000,000 tons ...

byline.original: By TURNER CATLEDGESpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
